title: Tito Puente
summary: Ernest Anthony "Tito" Puente, Jr. (April 20, 1923 â€“ June 1, 2000)[1] was an American musician of Puerto Rican descent, songwriter, record producer and bandleader. He is best known for dance-oriented mambo and Latin jazz compositions that endured over a 50-year career. His most famous song is "Oye Como Va".[2]
